intro: Monochasma, commonly known as the single-stemmed plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its unique structure, featuring a single, unbranched stem that supports its foliage and flowers. The leaves are typically arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem, and the flowers are small and clustered in composite heads. Monochasma species are often found in arid or semi-arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with their drought-resistant features. These plants play a role in local ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various insects and small animals.
